content:
Yes, there are conservation efforts in place to protect the forests in Cordillera. The Philippine government has established protected areas in the Cordillera region that include forests, such as natural parks, wildlife sanctuaries, and game refuges. These areas are managed by the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR), and activities that may damage or exploit the forests within them are restricted.

There are also non-governmental organizations and community-based groups that work to protect the forests of Cordillera. These organizations raise awareness about the importance of forest conservation, advocate for better forest management policies, and conduct reforestation and forest restoration activities.

In addition, there are programs that involve the participation of the local communities in forest conservation activities. These programs aim to promote community-based forest management and involve the local communities in planning and implementing activities to protect and manage the forests sustainably.

Overall, there are efforts in place to preserve the forests of Cordillera, and it is important to continue these efforts to ensure the long-term health and sustainability of the region's forests.
